intro: Psychotria tricephala, commonly known as the three-headed Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
